revised_title: Computational Modeling of JET Plasmas for Controlled Nuclear Fusion
tldr: This article discusses the development of a mathematical model for the JET (Joint European Torus) plasma, focusing on controlled nuclear fusion. The model uses computational methods to predict the behavior of JET plasmas and allows for extrapolation to future tokamak-type plasmas. The model takes into account various aspects of plasma behavior, including magnetic field configurations, particle transport, and energy conservation.
